pageContext.claim: “They've introduced a total Federal takeover of U.S. healthcare that would abolish the private health insurance of 180 million Americans.”
pageContext.analysis: The Medicare for all plan promoted by Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) would eliminate private insurance but not all Democratic candidates or lawmakers support such an idea. Plus, while the plan would eliminate private plans, it would create a national health insurance. (The Census Bureau says that in 2017, 217 million Americans had private insurance, with 181 million covered through an employer and 52 million directly purchasing it. Meanwhile, 123 million Americans are covered already through a government plan, such as Medicare, Medicaid or the military health system.)
